Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the portrait of Hillary Clinton was not hung by President Obama in 2016 as part of the holiday decorations.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that President Obama hung the portrait of Hillary Clinton prominently among numerous amounts of Christmas decorations as a "middle finger" to Donald Trump.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the portrait of the Trumps should have been hung instead of Hillary Clinton's, without providing any justification for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that the portrait of Hillary Clinton has been hanging in the White House since 2004, as unveiled by President George W. Bush.
